s.text: Girl Scouts experience a wide range of real life skills--first aid, resume writing, and managing money.
As a preventive, informal education program, Girl Scouting helps girls relate to others, develop values, contribute to their society, and develop their own potential.
A gift to the 1997 Girl Scout Annual Campaign helps to ensure that girls will continue to receive the benefits that Girl Scouting offers.
Now more than ever girls need your support to help their dreams become a reality.
